title: Pennfield teen ‘critical’ after accidental shooting
content:
A 19-year-old Pennfield woman was in critical condition after being shot by a .20-gauge shotgun Monday in the 100 block of Clarence Boulevard, the Calhoun County Sheriff deputies said.
Deputies responded to the incident about 12:20 p.m. Monday. The woman and a Pennfield boy, 13, had been target shooting and reportedly were walking to the residence when the boy’s firearm went off and shot the woman in the right side of her body.
The gunshot penetrated the woman’s right lung and caused damage to her right arm and torso. The woman was transported to Bronson Methodist Hospital in Kalamazoo. She was listed in critical condition, with stable vital signs, deputies said.
The shotgun was confiscated by the department. The case was under investigation.
